column4: does anyone know if I can do that with vino, or do I need the actual vncserver ?
I mean, I'd LIKE to not have to login to X
just start up a session via my windows machine
I mean I guess it's not that big a deal
here's what I would like to accomplish though
if my girlfriend is playing games in gnome
Sorry to ask the obvious, but why not use ssh to start up vnc when you need it?
Iw ant to be able to have a seperate gnome session on my machine that I can control - my gf would be sitting on the local machine tho
You could have a second X server, if that's what you're wanting.
I didn't realise that was an option..  see from what I understand, 'vino' autostarts with gnome..  how do I setup a second x server?
